intro: Beyeria lasiocarpa, commonly known as the rough-hairy beyeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Beyeria lasiocarpa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
